description:
Ithis is a DUMMY Program
it is only to show the author is an IDIOT
it does nothing and is a waste of time to install
imstall it and you will see

*** How to launch Grig to control your ham radio:
*** You need a ham radio attached via serial port or USB
*** You can not select or change radio type once in the GUI
*** You must -specify your radio, device port, and port speed at launch!
*** If you do not specify your radio it will load using a DUMMY radio which basically does nothing but look pretty so do not launch from the GUI icon shortcut, but do this from a terminal.

-First to find your radio model ID number - open terminal and type: 
 user@mypc:$grig --list
 
-Find corresponding radio ID number - There is 256 choices! -Mine is a Yeasu FT-991a so my radio ID is 1035
Launching grig with my model example:
user@mypc:$ grig -m 1035 -r /dev/ttyUSB0 -s 38400
or you may prefer:
user@mypc:$ grig --model=1035 --rig-file=/dev/ttyUSB0 --speed=38400 --debug=3

Keep hamming it up!
summary: Very nice start! - Keep developing! - Works with many radios!
